tool_description: Evaluates the physical condition of returned items and determines their disposition for resale, refurbishment, or disposal.

scan_confirmation_id.description: Confirmation ID from return item scanning process

item_conditions.description: Condition assessment for each item: new, like_new, good, fair, poor, damaged, defective

inspection_notes.description: Optional notes about specific condition issues

requires_cleaning.description: Whether items need cleaning before restocking

batch_processing.description: Whether this is part of a batch inspection

error_messages: Invalid scan confirmation ID: Confirmation ID not found or already inspected.
Invalid inspector ID: Inspector not found in quality control database.
Invalid condition values: Each condition must be one of [new, like_new, good, fair, poor, damaged, defective].
Condition count mismatch: Number of condition assessments must match number of scanned items.
Invalid inspection timestamp: Timestamp must be after scan timestamp and in ISO 8601 format.
Notes array length mismatch: If provided, inspection_notes array must match number of items.
usage: Input scan_confirmation_id, inspector_id, item_conditions array, and inspection_timestamp. Optionally add inspection_notes, requires_cleaning, requires_repackaging, and batch_processing flags.

inspection_report_id.description: Unique identifier for this inspection report

restockable_items.description: Items approved for return to inventory

disposal_items.description: Items marked for disposal or liquidation

total_refund_adjustment.description: Refund amount adjustment based on condition assessment
